com.nttdocomo.ui
Class Dialog

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Frame
        |
        +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Dialog
public final class Dialog
extends Frame

This defines dialogs. The dialog class realizes a function in low level and high level API that asks users to verify something by displaying a message.
Dialogs have buttons. The buttons to be displayed depend on the dialog type.

Dialog Type Button
DIALOG_ERRORBUTTON_OK
DIALOG_WARNINGBUTTON_OK
DIALOG_INFOBUTTON_OK
DIALOG_YESNOBUTTON_YES, BUTTON_NO
DIALOG_YESNOCANCELBUTTON_YES, BUTTON_NO, BUTTON_CANCEL
When switching the canvas or panel behind a dialog that is displayed is attempted with another thread, the switching occurs after the dialog is closed.
An exception is generated when a dialog is designated as the argument of the Display.setCurrent method.

See Also:
Canvas, Panel

Constructor Detail

Dialog

public Dialog(int type,
              java.lang.String title)
This generates dialogs by designating dialog types and the title character strings of dialogs.

Parameters:
type - Designates the dialog type.
title - Designates the title character string of the dialog. When null is designated, the empty character string (" ") is set.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is designated for the argument type
Method Detail

setBackground

public void setBackground(int color)
This sets the background color. When this method is called, the background color changes immediately. In default, an implementation dependent color is set.

Overrides:
setBackground in class Frame
Parameters:
color - Designates an integer that indicates the background color
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is set for argument c
See Also:
Graphics.clearRect(int, int, int, int)

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String msg)
This sets the message character string to be displayed. In default, the empty character string (" ") is set. When the message character string is too long to be displayed within dialog, the behavior is implementation dependent.

Parameters:
msg - Designates the message character string.

show

public int show()
         throws UIException
This displays dialog on the screen

Returns:
The pressed button
Throws:
UIException - Generated when a user tries to display dialog when dialog is already being displayed (BUSY_RESOURCE).

setSoftLabel

public void setSoftLabel(int key,
                         java.lang.String label)
This sets the label character string of the soft key. Since the label character string of the soft key cannot be changed in the dialog class, the functions are stopped in this class via overriding. Therefore, nothing happens even if this method is called.

Overrides:
setSoftLabel in class Frame
Parameters:
key - Designates the soft key number for setting the label character string.
label - Designates the label character string.
